text: Thapsigargin ( TG ) , an inhibitor of Ca ( 2+ ) - ATPase , depletes intracellular Ca2+ stores and induces a sustained Ca2+ influx without altering phosphatidyl inositol levels .

TG plus phorbol myristate acetate ( PMA ) but not TG alone induced <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Jurkat T cells , suggesting that TG had no effect on protein kinase C ( PKC ) .

However , TG induced increases in <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein as well as <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in Jurkat T cells in a dose - dependent manner .

text: A similar increase in <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by TG was also observed in human peripheral T cells .
Further , like PMA , TG markedly induced NF kappa B in Jurkat T cells .

However , TG and PMA exhibited a synergistic action on <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , suggesting that TG and PMA induce <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> through distinct pathways .

text: In toto , these results suggest that TG induces <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human T cells through a PKC - independent pathway .
